intro: Buchosia, commonly known as the "false holly," is a genus of flowering plants in the family Rhamnaceae. It consists of shrubs or small trees that are native to various regions in the Americas. The plants typically have small, opposite leaves and produce small, inconspicuous flowers. Buchosia species are often found in dry, rocky habitats and are adapted to arid environments. They are sometimes used in horticulture for their ornamental value and hardy nature.
